name: 'Schotter', Georg Nees - Variation 01
description: Starting with Georg Nees 'Schotter' as a base, I changed the colors of the quares randomly. This change made the piece look more lively and a little more chaotic.

name: 'Schotter', Georg Nees - Variation 02
description: Changing the shape of the squares to triangles changed the feeling of the piece, making it look sharper.

name: 'Schotter', Georg Nees - Variation 03
description: The squares 'dance' around by changing sizes and rotate depending on their position on the canvas. The farther away from the top they are, the faster they spin.

name: 'Plotting', Michael Noll - Variation 01
description: Inspired by Michael Nolls 'Plotting', I changed the size of the rectangles and the colors randomly, making it look like confetti.

name: 'Plotting', Michael Noll - Variation 02
description: By changing the shape of the rectangles to circles and removing the colored filling, this piece reminds of bubbles in the water.

name: 'Plotting', Michael Noll - Variation 03
description: The randomly generated rectanges pulse from the center outwards, looking a little bit like breathing. The farther away they are from the center, the lighter they become.

name: Emory Dunn - Variation 01
description: Adding to Emory Dunns experiments, I animated the lines and added particles whenever a line reaches its destination point on the circle. It then 'bounces back', creating an endless loop of little explosions, reminding of a firework.

name: Emory Dunn - Variation 02
description: For this piece, I changed the shape to a square and created a flow field.

name: Colin Reid - Sound Variation
description: The circles create different sounds depending on the size.
